column1: The name of your resource. Please feel free to provide multiple resources by filling in multiple columns. Please provide all resources you would like Smart Money visitors to be connected to. Ex: First Time Homebuyer Program, Revolving Loan Fund, One-on-one counseling etc.
column2: In a few sentences, please describe what your resource is and what it can offer clients.
column4: The full address of your organization.
column5: If different than organization address, the full address of where this resource is located.
column6: The web address where we can find more information about your resource.
column7: Please describe how someone can access your resource. Ex: Walk-ins welcome, call to schedule an appointment, complete the application online etc.
column8: If not provided above, who's the best person to contact (if there is one person) for more information on this resource? Please provide their full name, phone number and/or e-mail address
column9: Any comments you have on your responses to the above fields.
column10: Any requirements clients must meet in order to access your resouce. Ex: Female only, over 18 years old, income is greater than/less than x-amount etc.
column11: All languages this resource is offered in.
column12: Classify what your resource is - is your resource a product or program or other? Ex: Small class, one-on-one counseling, financial product etc.
column13: Does this resource cover this topic? Please respond with "Yes" or "No".
column14: Does this resource cover this topic? Please respond with "Yes" or "No".

column2: Our InfoLine service provides immediate access to a financial counselor by phone. Our counselors can answer a wide variety of financial and credit related questions and calls can last anywhere from 5 to 30 minuted depending on your question and the amount of information you are looking for.
column4: 595 Market Street, 16th FloorSan Francisco, CA 94105
column7: Call us at 888-456-2227 or email us at info@balancepro.org

column2: At BALANCE, our money management program will offer you a one-on-one counseling with one of our qualified counselors to discuss general money management, credit and housing topics including goal setting, and credit. Each session is goal orriented and results in a written action plan clearly outlining the steps you and your counselor decide to take to establish personal financial control.
column4: 595 Market Street, 16th FloorSan Francisco, CA 94105
column7: Call us at 888-456-2227 or email us at info@balancepro.org to schedule an appointment

column2: Our Debt Management program is designed to help our clients who are having trouble keeping up with their bills. Our counselors will go over your income, living exspenses, and debt in detail and will offer information and suggestions for dealing with debt issues such as rent or mortgage paymeny, credit card bills, and much more.
column4: 595 Market Street, 16th FloorSan Francisco, CA 94105
column7: Call us at 888-456-2227 or email us at info@balancepro.org to schedule an appointment

column2: Our Credit Report Review program offers a free or low-cost copy of your credit report and provides a free and confidetial credit report review to ensure you hace the tools necessary to maintain and protect you credit standing.
column4: 595 Market Street, 16th FloorSan Francisco, CA 94105
column7: Go to our website at https://www.balancepro.net for a free or low-cost credit report.

column2: The Housing Education Program at BALANCE will teach our clients how your debt to income ration will affect the amount of money you can borrow and also give an understanding of the mortgage loan process.
column4: 595 Market Street, 16th FloorSan Francisco, CA 94105
column7: Call us at 888-456-2227 or email us at info@balancepro.org to start delveloping your personal plan.

column2: At Brighter Beginnings, each of our individual or family clients will complete a financial assessment form and participate in workshops teaching basic topics such as "Banking 101" and setting a budget.

column2: At CFPB, we provide free foreclosure help. If you are behind on your mortgage, or having a hard time making payments, we want to get you in touch with a HUD approved housing counselor. Your counselor can develop a plan of action for your situation and help you work with your mortgage company, they can help you organize your finances, and understand your mortgage options to find a solution that works for you.
column7: Go online to find  a counselor near you

column2: At CDHC, our combination of informational workshops and one-on-one counseling, CDHC's First Time Homebuyer Program will teach you everything from preparing yourself financially to completing the purchase. Individuals who qualify for this program can also apple for the Down Payment Assistance and real estate services which is a 'silent' down payment assistance loan for low income households purchasing in Contra Costa County.
column7: Complete our Homebuyer Program Intake Form which is avialable online.
column10: Low-income first time home buyer, 18 and over

column2: Our Foreclosure Intervention and Loan Modification offers counseling to anyone especially those in lower income communities. We offer support on the loan modification process which can be complex and technical, and our counselors have the knowledge and experience to help you get the best possible resolution.
column7: Complete our online intake form and attend the next schedules workshop on Foreclosure Intervention and Mitigation. You can get all the information and the document you will need to bring online

column2: CHDC offers Financial Fitness education classes with the goal of empowering individuals and families to take control of their money and to set and to achieve personal goals, also to increase their financial security. column2: At HOPE, our program Banking on Our future elevates the dignity, hope, and economic self- suddiciency of people in low-income communities through financial literacy. BOOF classes are free for both schools and communities and are led by HOPE Corps voluteers who have undergone comprehensive training in financial literacy and teaching techniques.

column2: HOPE Financial Dignity Centers offer financial literacy classes and one-on-one counseling on homeownership, mortgages, forclosure, credit, small business, and more. We help low- income communities to secure loans from local banks and to open in locations where banking is not available to the community.
column7: Walk-ins at our locatios are welcomed

column2: COPE Coalition America is the only financial emergency preparedness and recovery sevice in the country.  We provide financial and economic assistance to those affected by natural disasters. We act to help individuals and families to prepare for disaster and recover in the shortest time possible. Through our HOPE Crisis Hotline and our on-site counseling centers, they help clients recover financially from natural disasters, foreclosures, and other emergencies.
column4: 1215 Prytania Street Suite 103New Orleans, Louisiana 70130
column7: Go online to see upcoming events, walk in to one of our on- site counseling centers, or call out HOPE Crisis Hotline at 888-388-4673

column2: SFHDC's Foreclosure Intervention Program is to help alleviate the emotional stress experienced by mortgage default home owners and to counsel troubled homeowners in San Francisco Bay Area, who have been severely impacted by the nation's troubled housing market epidemic. Our program specialist work closely with lenders and brokers to negotiate fair and realistic solutions that lead at-risk homeowners to financial stability and to prevent foreclosure.
column7: Make an appointment online

column2: SFHDC's Financial Fitness Program is designed to help families and individuals develop the self-confidence and the self-discipline it takes to purchase a home. Our services are customized to meet the needs of out clients. Our goal is to empower our clients to learn the 3 most important steps to homeownership: Budget, Credit, and savings. Our 8 hour homebuyer education class consist of 4 hours of workshops and 4 hours of counseling. The counseling service will help clients improve their credits, balance their budget, and develop a savings plan.
column7: Complete an online application

column2: SFDC's City Second Loan Program offers financial assistance to first time home buyers by oroviding no interest, 40 year deferred loan up to $100,000 or 30% of the home purchase price from MOH(Mayor's Office of Housing)
column5: 1 South Van Ness, 5th FlSan Francisco, CA 94103
column9: This loan is restricted to units or homes located within selected developments

column2: SFHDC's Mortgage Credit Certificate Program can help qualify you for a mortgage loan by increasing your buying power at your current income level. This certificate provides assistance to first-time homebuyers for the purchase of owner-occupied  subgle family homes, town-homes, and condominiums. If eligble it can help reduce the amount of your federal income taxes and allow you to take the appropriate tax credit every year.
column10: First time Home Buyers, 18 and over

column2: The Down Payment Assistance Program is a down payment assistance loan to low-moderate income first time home buyers in San Francisco purchasing any single family home in the City and County of San Francisco. DALP is a silent second loan that required no payment for 40 years.
column5: 1 South Van Ness, 5th Fl.San Francisco, CA 94103
column7: Go online to check Eligibility
column9: Not available for a BMR unit (Below Market Rate or Inclusionary)

column2: If you are having trouble keeping up with your bills, our Debt Management Plan (DMP) allows you to make one payment to all your creditors. Your creditors may be willing to stop collection action, lower payments and even reduce or eliminate interest and fees.Free, confidential consultations with a professional counselor are available weekdays, evenings, and weekends. No matter where you live, we can help. We offer counseling by phone and we pay for the call.During your hour-long session, your counselor will review your income, expenses and debt in detail in order to determine your best options for becoming debt free.
column3: Consumer Credit Counseling Service of San Francisco
column4: 595 Market Street, 15th FloorSan Francisco CA 94105
column7: Call us at 800-777-PLAN Monday through Friday between 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. (Pacific Standard Time), or email us and we'll call you back to schedule the appointment. Please include your referral source in your email.info@cccssf.org

column2: MEDAÕs Financial Education & Coaching Program helps low- and moderate-income families reach their financial goals. We offer Spanish and English personal finance workshops and customized one/one coaching to help our clients develop the knowledge, mindset, and habits needed to achieve financial capability and build wealth.
column4: Plaza Adelante2301 Mission St., Suite 301San Francisco, CA 94110
column7: Call/email to [1] enroll in the monthly financial education workshop; [2] attend the workshop; [3] set one/one coaching appointment
column12: Small group workshops, one-on-one personal finance coaching; access to financial products through community partners

column2: MEDAÕs Homeownership program provides one-on-one counseling sessions and group workshop curriculum in both Spanish and English. We offer homeownership related services including financial education, credit counseling, information on down payment and closing costs assistance programs, affordable housing options, and foreclosure intervention counseling. Homeowners also learn how to protect themselves from predatory lenders and counselors conduct loan document reviews. MEDA is a HUD Approved Housing Counseling agency and a member of the local collaborative known as Homeownership SF, which strongly advocates and supports affordable housing.
column4: Plaza Adelante2301 Mission St., Suite 301San Francisco, CA 94110
column7: Call/email to [1] enroll in the monthly financial education workshop; [2] attend the workshop; [3] set one/one coaching appointment

column2: MEDA's business development program helps entrepreneurs in San Francisco to start and expand their businesses. We provide services through individual consultations and group workshops, in both English and Spanish. MEDA consultants offer expertise on access to capital, business assessment, business planning, financial projections, budgeting, marketing, lease consultation, and services tailored specifically to family childcare providers in San Francisco.
column4: Plaza Adelante2301 Mission St., Suite 301San Francisco, CA 94110
column10: Entrepreneurs must be meet income eligibility requirements (low- moderate-income individuals over 18) and own (or plan to own) a microenterprise in San Francisco. A microenterprise is defined as a business with five employees or less, including the owner(s).

column2: MEDAÕs VITA Site Free Tax Preparation Program serves low-income families in San Francisco by providing free tax return preparation year round; benefits screening; and self-employed tax education. MEDA also offers  ITIN application services and free assistance to low-income and Spanish-speaking students in completing the Free Application for Student Aid (FAFSA).
column4: Plaza Adelante2301 Mission St., Suite 301San Francisco, CA 94110
column12: Small group workshops, one-on-one counseling; access to financial products through community partners

column2: MAF's lending circle program are zero- free and interest credit building social laons for low- income community members. Now those with no credit scores or damaged credit scores can now join a lending circle that builds credit, with an average score increase of 168 point. A positive credit history opens the door to many financial opportunities
column7: Call us at (888)274-4808 Monday- Friday from 9AM to 5PM (Pacific Standard Time) or email us at info@missionassetfund.org
column12: Small group (Low-income communities band together to find a workable solution)

column2: MAF's Lending Circle for Citizenship program is to organize low-income individuals to save and lend to each-other to cover citizenship fees. As an incentive we provide a 25% match to help make your goal a reality. Lending Circles for Citizenship is a unique credit-building matched saving program that helps individuals overcome steep financial obstacles to citizenship.
column7: Call us at (888)274-4808 Monday- Friday from 9AM to 5PM (Pacific Standard Time) or email us at info@missionassetfund.org
column10: low- income participants to gain citizenship
column12: Organizing low-income individuals to save and lend to each-other

column2: MAF's Lending Circled for Dreamers program organizes young low- income people to lend and borrow money from each other and save 1/3 of the $465 application cost. Our new policy will help promising young people obtain protection from deportation and provide access to work permits, a first step towards securing their future. This will help them pursue higher education, meaningful employment and a chance to provide meaningful contributuions to our country.
column7: Call us at (888)274-4808 Monday- Friday from 9AM to 5PM (Pacific Standard Time) or email us at info@missionassetfund.org
column12: Low-income young people borrow and lend money to each other

column2: The Security Deposit Loan program by MAFtransforms security deposits into a responsible savings and credit- buildingopportunity for disadvataged young peoplewho are struggling to obtain stable housing.MAF allows qualifying participants to save for a security deposit on their first apartment, while establishing positive credit histories and credit scores.
column7: Call us at (888)274-4808 Monday- Friday from 9AM to 5PM (Pacific Standard Time) or email us at info@missionassetfund.org
column10: young individuals struggling to obtain stable housing

column2: MAF's Resource Match Program is an online screening tool that connects low-income client with the sevices theyneed,both government and communitybased services.Participants can get access to food stamps, low-cost checking accounts, housing and employment assistance programs in your neighborhood all at the same time. This program takes the guess work out of getting people to the services they need, the system is presently used by 36 community-based organizations, schoos, and public departments.
column7: Call us at (888)274-4808 Monday- Friday from 9AM to 5PM (Pacific Standard Time) or email us at info@missionassetfund.org
